coordinate_convention: Circle formation: dancers oriented tangent to the circle unless otherwise stated; forward = direction currently facing; left/right are dancer-relative; center = toward circle center; around the circle = along the circle in the line-of-dance direction (left-facing described explicitly when given).

steps.direction: across in front (R across in front of L)
steps.notes: Grapevine count 1: step R foot across in front of L foot.
Grapevine count 2: step on L foot to L.
Grapevine count 3: step on R foot behind L foot.
Grapevine count 4: step on L foot to L; turning a bit as you go so the R foot goes more forward and backward rather than directly crossing.
Repeat the grapevine (counts 1–4) three more times.
Run four steps forward, R L R L. Begin leaning forward with arms down on 1, then straighten up and raise arms during 2–4.
Arms down on 1 while beginning to lean forward.
Straighten up and raise arms during 2–4.
Take four steps backwards, R L R L, bringing arms back down again. Variation: clap on count 5 before beginning to bring the arms down.
Variation: clap on count 5 before beginning to bring the arms down.
Bring arms back down during 5–8 (earlier version brings arms down on 5).
Repeat counts 1–8.
Facing left, begin running around the circle.
Facing left, run three steps forward around the circle, R L R.
face center while hopping on R and touching L foot slightly to the side.
Hop on R (simultaneous with facing change).
Touch L foot slightly to the side (no weight).
Facing center, hop on R foot while touching L toe in front.
Touch L toe in front (no weight).
Facing center, hop on R foot while touching L to side, near R foot and slightly to the back.

steps.direction: side/back (near R, slightly to the back)
steps.notes: Touch L to side near R foot and slightly to the back (no weight).
Repeat counts 5–6 three more times; on 12 transfer some weight onto L foot.
On 12 transfer some weight onto L foot.
Repeat counts 5–12 with opposite footwork and clapping hands each time you touch R in front, finishing with R foot free to start Part 1 again. (Variation: some people turn while doing counts 13–20).

steps.amount: on each front touch (R in front)
steps.notes: Clap hands each time you touch R in front (during opposite-footwork repetition).
Variation: some people turn while doing counts 13–20.

inferred_relations.notes: Dance is in a circle formation throughout unless locally altered by facing changes.
Parts proceed sequentially: Part 1 (1–16), then Part 2 (1–16), then Part 3 (1–20), then return to Part 1.
